parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization Bearer obtained using the client credential flow (OAuth2).

description: Welcome to Accounts Information API. Initially, you need to create a sandbox, by replacing the sandbox id with a unique id. To create a sandbox, you need an access token.

security.description: A guid that uniquely identifies your application
security.name: Client-Id

parameters.name: sandbox_id
parameters.description: The unique name of your Sandbox

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization Bearer obtained using the authorization code flow (OAuth2)

parameters.name: Request-Id
parameters.description: A guid that uniquely identifies your request

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: Signature (Detached JWS signature)

parameters.name: TPP-Signature-Certificate
parameters.description: TPP-Signature-Certificate (X.509 certificate in .pem format)

parameters.name: X-Certificate-Check
parameters.description: A Boolean to enable or disable the certificate validation

description: In this part of the API, you can retrieve information about a specified logged-in user. In addition, you will obtain your user id and the phone number where the OTP will be sent. To successfully collect information, you have to provide your sandbox id, your access token, and a random UUID.

security.description: A guid that uniquely identifies your application
security.name: Client-Id

description: Here, you can create a consent id. The consent id is necessary in order to have access to consent UI. Just provide your sandbox id, your access token, and a random UUID.

So, to gain information, you need to provide a sandbox id, your access token, your consent id, and a random UUID.

description: Finally, feel free to retrieve a standing orders list of your NBG account. As a result, you will receive information like a revoke date, your credit account number, your total payments, and many more briefings. All you need to do is to provide your sandbox id, your access token, your consent id, and a random UUID.
